trans-unit.source: ms.ContentId: 7dcd6da0-dd72-422d-8752-5eccc8116e02
trans-unit.target: ms.ContentId: 7dcd6da0-dd72-422d-8752-5eccc8116e02

trans-unit.source: title: Managing remote Hyper-V hosts
trans-unit.target: title: Managing remote Hyper-V hosts

trans-unit.source: Manage Remote Hyper-V Hosts with Hyper-V Manager
trans-unit.target: Manage Remote Hyper-V Hosts with Hyper-V Manager

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Manager provides tools for diagnosing and managing your local Hyper-V host and a small number of remote hosts.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Manager provides tools for diagnosing and managing your local Hyper-V host and a small number of remote hosts.

trans-unit.source: This article documents the configuration steps for connecting to Hyper-V hosts using Hyper-V Manager in all supported configurations.
trans-unit.target: This article documents the configuration steps for connecting to Hyper-V hosts using Hyper-V Manager in all supported configurations.

trans-unit.source: To connect to a Hyper-V host in Hyper-V Manager, make sure Hyper-V Manager is selected in the left hand pane and then select Connect to Server... in the right-hand pane.
trans-unit.target: To connect to a Hyper-V host in Hyper-V Manager, make sure Hyper-V Manager is selected in the left hand pane and then select Connect to Server... in the right-hand pane.

trans-unit.source: Supported Hyper-V host combinations with Hyper-V Manager
trans-unit.target: Supported Hyper-V host combinations with Hyper-V Manager

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 10 allows you to manage:
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 10 allows you to manage:

trans-unit.source: Windows 10
trans-unit.target: Windows 10

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 allows you to manage:
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 allows you to manage:

trans-unit.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts
trans-unit.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts

trans-unit.source: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts
trans-unit.target: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts

trans-unit.source: Note: Not all Hyper-V Manager functionality works for all host versions.
trans-unit.target: Note: Not all Hyper-V Manager functionality works for all host versions.

trans-unit.source: Manage localhost
trans-unit.target: Manage localhost

trans-unit.source: To add localhost to Hyper-V Manager as a Hyper-V host, select Local computer in the Select Computer dialogue box.
trans-unit.target: To add localhost to Hyper-V Manager as a Hyper-V host, select Local computer in the Select Computer dialogue box.

trans-unit.source: If a connection can't be established:
trans-unit.target: If a connection can't be established:

trans-unit.source: Make sure the Hyper-V server role is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Make sure the Hyper-V server role is enabled.

trans-unit.source: See the <link><linkText>walkthrough section for checking compatability</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See the <link><linkText>walkthrough section for checking compatability</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Confirm that your user account is part of the Hyper-V Administrator group.
trans-unit.target: Confirm that your user account is part of the Hyper-V Administrator group.

trans-unit.source: Manage a Hyper-V host in your domain
trans-unit.target: Manage a Hyper-V host in your domain

trans-unit.source: To add a remote Hyper-V host to Hyper-V Manager, select Another computer in the Select Computer dialogue box and enter the remote host's hostname, NetBIOS, or FQDN into the text field.
trans-unit.target: To add a remote Hyper-V host to Hyper-V Manager, select Another computer in the Select Computer dialogue box and enter the remote host's hostname, NetBIOS, or FQDN into the text field.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 greatly expanded the possible combinations of remote connection types.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 greatly expanded the possible combinations of remote connection types.

trans-unit.source: Now you can connect to a remote Windows 10 or later host using either the host name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Now you can connect to a remote Windows 10 or later host using either the host name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Manager now supports alternate credentials as well.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Manager now supports alternate credentials as well.

trans-unit.source: In order to manage remote Hyper-V hosts, remote management must be enabled on both computers.
trans-unit.target: In order to manage remote Hyper-V hosts, remote management must be enabled on both computers.

trans-unit.source: You can do this through System Properties -> Remote Management Settings or by running the following PowerShell command as Administrator:
trans-unit.target: You can do this through System Properties -> Remote Management Settings or by running the following PowerShell command as Administrator:

trans-unit.source: If your current user account matches a Hyper-V Administrator account on the remote host, go ahead and press OK to Connect.
trans-unit.target: If your current user account matches a Hyper-V Administrator account on the remote host, go ahead and press OK to Connect.

trans-unit.source: This is the only supported way to manage a remote host in Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8 or Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: This is the only supported way to manage a remote host in Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8 or Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the remote host as a different user
trans-unit.target: Connect to the remote host as a different user

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10, if you are not running with the correct user account for the remote host, you can connect as another user with alternate credentials.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10, if you are not running with the correct user account for the remote host, you can connect as another user with alternate credentials.

trans-unit.source: To specify credentials for the remote Hyper-V host, select Connect as another user: ** in the **Select Computer dialogue box then select Set User....
trans-unit.target: To specify credentials for the remote Hyper-V host, select Connect as another user: ** in the **Select Computer dialogue box then select Set User....

trans-unit.source: Note: It's very easy to forget to set the user and click OK with user not specified.
trans-unit.target: Note: It's very easy to forget to set the user and click OK with user not specified.

trans-unit.source: If your connection fails, make sure you actually did set the user.
trans-unit.target: If your connection fails, make sure you actually did set the user.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the remote host using IP address
trans-unit.target: Connect to the remote host using IP address

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it's easier to connect using IP address rather than host name.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes it's easier to connect using IP address rather than host name.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 allows your to do just that.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 allows your to do just that.

trans-unit.source: To connect using IP address, enter the IP address into the Another Computer text field.
trans-unit.target: To connect using IP address, enter the IP address into the Another Computer text field.

trans-unit.source: Manage a Hyper-V host outside your domain (or with no domain)
trans-unit.target: Manage a Hyper-V host outside your domain (or with no domain)

trans-unit.source: Local Hyper-V Host:
trans-unit.target: Local Hyper-V Host:

trans-unit.source: Enable-PSRemoting
trans-unit.target: Enable-PSRemoting

trans-unit.source: Came back with netowork set to public.
trans-unit.target: Came back with netowork set to public.

trans-unit.source: Ran
trans-unit.target: Ran

trans-unit.source: Set-NetConnectionProfile -Name "name" -NetworkCategory private
trans-unit.target: Set-NetConnectionProfile -Name "name" -NetworkCategory private

trans-unit.source: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force

trans-unit.source: Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role client -DelegateComputer *
trans-unit.target: Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role client -DelegateComputer *

trans-unit.source: For workgroup only:
trans-unit.target: For workgroup only:

trans-unit.source: (should be done) Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* ].
trans-unit.target: (should be done) Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* ].

trans-unit.source: To list of computers, check the box forConcatenate OS defaults with input above
trans-unit.target: To list of computers, check the box forConcatenate OS defaults with input above

trans-unit.source: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials with NTLM-only server authentication → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* to list of computers, check the box for Concatenate OS defaults with input above
trans-unit.target: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials with NTLM-only server authentication → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* to list of computers, check the box for Concatenate OS defaults with input above

trans-unit.source: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow CredSSP authentication → Set to enabled
trans-unit.target: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow CredSSP authentication → Set to enabled

trans-unit.source: Remote Hyper-V Host:
trans-unit.target: Remote Hyper-V Host:

trans-unit.source: Disabled the firewall :)
trans-unit.target: Disabled the firewall :)

trans-unit.source: Enable-PSRemoting
trans-unit.target: Enable-PSRemoting

trans-unit.source: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force
trans-unit.target: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force

trans-unit.source: So that's the demo-only instructions I used.
trans-unit.target: So that's the demo-only instructions I used.

trans-unit.source: Replace * and turn off firewall with a single computer and letting credssp and winRM through
trans-unit.target: Replace * and turn off firewall with a single computer and letting credssp and winRM through
